@*****

author: Metalman200xdamnit

text:
@*****
¬†I do not know. Parents can be a little uptight these days.
author: Metalman200xdamnit

text:
@*****
And it is far easier to blame video games than to be actual parent.
author: Metalman200xdamnit

text:
@*****
It did not work for Jack Ryan and it will not work today,haha.
author: Metalman200xdamnit

text:
@*****
If anything,the ESRB (the organization that slaps the M on the cover of your game) indirectly promotes the violent games,now kids know what game to look for.
author: Metalman200xdamnit

text:
@*****
¬†Parents want an "easy mode" to parenting,they do not want to take the time and effort to talk to and educate their kids.
author: Metalman200xdamnit

text:
@*****
Simple,we have lazy punks raising even lazier and privileged kids.
author: Metalman200xdamnit

@*****

text: WayForward really did well in going with the 80's feel for this game and Kaufman certainly understood that with his soundtrack. He really achieved the 80's cheesiness with this song and its lyrics. The single player is alright but the game absolutely shines when you play with a buddy.
